channel.title: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!
channel.description:
I think I finally have torrent support for java wrapped up, hopefully. Can you all download this jar:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/ResourceGrabber.jar
And run it, this is the usage, also obtained by running without any arguments: [code]java -jar ResourceGrabber.jar Usage: ResourceGrabber [[TORRENT|MAGNETURL|URL] SAVE_PATH EXTRACT CRC] TORRENT is a path to a .torrent file MAGNETURL is a magnet link URL is a url to a torrent file, or any file over HTTP SAVE_PATH is the absolute path to save the torrent and .resume file to EXTRACT is true if you wish to extract the downloaded file CRC if not 0 will only download the file if the CRC does not match, it will checksum every file in the save_path recursively.
You can specify as many downloads on the command line as you wish.[/code]
An example that will download the free and legal Ubuntu 11.04 iso via bittorrent is this: [code]java -jar ResourceGrabber.jar "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:a38d02c287893842a32825aa866e00828a318f07&dn=Ubuntu+11.04+%28Final%29&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.publicbt.com%3A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.ccc.de%3A80" "/tmp" false 0[/code] Don't forget the quotes due to the funky characters in there.
Also try multiple downloads at the same time, you can specify as many as you want!
You can download anything supported by Java's URLConnection class (as far as I know, HTTP and HTTPS, also possibly FTP), and any torrent via file, magnet url, and HTTP url to the torrent itself. It will pop up a nice little GUI showing you the progress, and also tell you some key points via command line. This will download my platform-specific java_client to your computer, but will only run it if the CRC matches.
It will NOT download or extract any files with the following extensions, for safety: ".exe", ".bat", ".cmd", ".com", ".sh", ".bash"
Please post logs if you have any problems, and as always post hints/suggestions. All of this code will be released free and open source under the GNU/GPL, probably at github. It is written modulary enough where you can write any front-end you want, this one just happens to be Swing.
edit: If any of you are actually worried, or just curious, I attached the full java source, as well as the C++ source code to the binary, and my build scripts. When I officially release it, it will probably be at github: https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/ResourceGrabber.src.7z

item.title: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“eXemplar, post:14, topic:403813”]I downloaded this program and my computer simultaneously caught fire and aids, my screens melted, speakers grew legs and kicked my dog, drove away in my car and ran over the cat and withrew 200$ from my bank account.

Virus, don’t dl.[/quote]

Shit, it only withdrew $200? Thanks for the bug report, I’ll fix right away.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It really shouldn’t slow down your connection much, since it’s enabled to use the new uTP protocol which goes over UDP and is meant to yield to TCP.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!

item.title: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“yo123, post:1, topic:406994”]Works on 32-bit Windows XP

This thing popped up but strangely, the torrent was being downloaded regardless… I hit Unblock of course. If I clicked Keep Blocking, would the torrent have stopped?

But why is it so damn slow? That’s dial-up speed yo

And my Java version:

java version "1.6.0_26"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_26-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 20.1-b02, mixed mode, sharing)

Mopar, if this thing starts downloading at proper speed, I’m going to be using only this 'cause it’s so lightweight

Edit: This is making my connection really slow even though it’s downloading at 10 kB/s[/quote]
I assume it also seeds/uploads the torrent (otherwise MITB is a dick)

If you hit keep blocking, it wouldn’t upload anything, but it could still download. It might be slowing down your connection if its uploading at maximum speed.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!

item.title: Calling all Mac/Windows/BSD/Linux users, test AGAIN please!
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Works on Vista 64 Bit

C:\Users\Unlimited\Desktop>java -jar ResourceGrabber.jar "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:a38d02c287893842a32 825aa866e00828a318f07&dn=Ubuntu+11.04+%28Final%29&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80&tr= udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.publicbt.com%3A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.ccc.de%3A80" "/tmp" false 0 Starting download 1, url: 'magnet:?xt=urn:btih:a38d02c287893842a32825aa866e00828a318f07&dn=Ubuntu+11 .04+%28Final%29&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.openbittorrent.com%3A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.publicbt.com%3 A80&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.ccc.de%3A80' savePath: '/tmp' extract: 'false' crc: '0' Checksum so far: 0 Checking filename: C:\Users\Unlimited\.moparscape\bin\java_client.win32.exe Started download 1 Started all downloads, now waiting until they all finish!

C:\Users\Unlimited>java -version java version "1.6.0_19" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_19-b04) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 16.2-b04, mixed mode)
Also it just started to download to /tmp in the directory I was in (Desktop)

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Could you guys please test this once more? I believe I have the windows problem fixed and it should download on that operating system now (I’ve tested XP), I shouldn’t have done anything to break Linux/OSX support, but if you wouldn’t mind testing the new one I’d appreciate that as well.
